div.p: B202 F. M. Bailey inward correspondence, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

Last Saturday I received your note accompanying that of Baron von Muellers
Letter not found. and if I delayed answering it, my travelling through the southern portion of my district was the cause of it.

It is to a visit to New Guinea that the Baron refers in his letter. Long we discussed the plan while I was in Melbourne. The visit as yet is only a project which perhaps will not be realized on account of many difficulties. I never mentioned the matter to you, because I had not taken any determination about it, perhaps the trip would not come off, and so it was idle to talk to you about it. Why do you say about this visit, that you hope it will not come to pass? My difficulty are at starting. Once there I believe the difficulties will not be unsurmountable however great they may be.

I keep my plan still a secret among few, when I shall take my final decision about it, if it will come off, can be made public. Only Mr [Marrossan] to whom I communicated the plan to see what assistance I would be like to obtain from the Government in the event of my going, knows it in Brisbane
